tool.name: FlatPackedMapCircles

param.name: out_fc
param.dialogReference: The output feature class that will be created and to which the results will be written.
param.pythonReference: The output feature class that will be created and to which the results will be written.

param.name: value
param.dialogReference: Specifies the numeric field containing the attribute values that will be used to scale the area of each proportional circle. Null values are excluded from the calculations.
param.pythonReference: Specifies the numeric field containing the attribute values that will be used to scale the area of each proportional circle. Null values are excluded from the calculations.

param.name: group_field
param.dialogReference:
The field in the input that will be used to geographically aggregate features. Features within each group will have their coordinates averaged to determine the centroid of the packed circle.

Suggested values might included administrative areas such as, neighborhoods, states/provinces, and countries.
param.pythonReference:
The field in the input that will be used to geographically aggregate features. Features within each group will have their coordinates averaged to determine the centroid of the packed circle.

Suggested values might included administrative areas such as, neighborhoods, states/provinces, and countries.

param.name: sort_field
param.dialogReference: Specifies the field whose values will be used to reorder the input records.
param.pythonReference: Specifies the field whose values will be used to reorder the input records.

param.name: sort_dir
param.dialogReference:
Specifies the direction the records will be sorted.

  • DEFAULT: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in the order they enter the tool.

  • ASCENDING: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in ascending order of the values of the features.

  • DSCEDNING: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in descending order of the values of the features.

  • RANDOM: The circles within each packed circle will be randomly arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise). Repeat iteration of the tool will not be identical.
param.pythonReference:
Specifies the direction the records will be sorted.

  • DEFAULT: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in the order they enter the tool.

  • ASCENDING: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in ascending order of the values of the features.

  • DSCEDNING: The circles within each packed circle will be arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise) in descending order of the values of the features.

  • RANDOM: The circles within each packed circle will be randomly arranged from the centroid outwards (counter-clockwise). Repeat iteration of the tool will not be identical.

param.name: diam_min
param.dialogReference:
A numerical constraint that will be used to determine the minimum proportional circle symbol diameter. The area of the circle symbols will be scaled proportionally based on their data value.

This measurement uses the units of the input feature coordinate system and may require some experimentation to achieve the desired effect.
param.pythonReference:
A numerical constraint that will be used to determine the minimum proportional circle symbol diameter. The area of the circle symbols will be scaled proportionally based on their data value.

This measurement uses the units of the input feature coordinate system and may require some experimentation to achieve the desired effect.

param.name: diam_max
param.dialogReference:
A numerical constraint that will be used to determine the maximum proportional circle symbol diameter. The area of the circle symbols will be scaled proportionally based on their data value.

This measurement uses the units of the input feature coordinate system and may require some experimentation to achieve the desired effect.
param.pythonReference:
A numerical constraint that will be used to determine the maximum proportional circle symbol diameter. The area of the circle symbols will be scaled proportionally based on their data value.

This measurement uses the units of the input feature coordinate system and may require some experimentation to achieve the desired effect.

tool.summary:
Geoprocessing tool that creates packed circles on a map. This tool is able to quickly create a packed circle for every feature in the input feature class or layer without any hierarchy. Hence the "flat packed" name.

For use cases where the presentation of the data requires hierarchy or where the number of individual features per circle is relatively few then the Hierarchical Packed Circle tool may provide a better result.
